intro: Galium commune subsp. umbellatum, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbel-like clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. The species is characterized by its hairy stems and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
